Html: All this xml is beyond me. I can't seem to get my head arround all the code. Must be getting old. Would it be possible for you to post the Harvard Referecing-Sheffield University style?

Sorry, but I don't do requests. I do help with specific problems with format strings you might have.

All the code you need is listed between <xsl:variable name="data"> and the corresponding </xsl:variable>. Normally it should be listed right at the top of the file. The 3500 lines which comes after that part can be ignored by you. They form the 'engine' for the top part. The content of the <xsl:variable name="data"> is pretty much selfexplaining. Citation stands for citation, bibliography for bibliography, namelists contains info on formatting names, and so on. The only 'difficult' thing are the format strings. And that part is covered by the documentation: http://bibword.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=BibWord%20Format%20Strings&referringTitle=Documentation
